Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the photograph was taken at the Operation Gridlock protest in Michigan when it was actually taken a month earlier at a protest in Boise, Idaho.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it only presents one photograph without providing any additional evidence or context.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the person holding the flag is a Trump supporter, but additional images from the event show that the person was also holding a Bernie Sanders sign at another point during the rally, suggesting that their political affiliation may not be accurately represented.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation for the presence of the swastika flag, as the photograph mentions that a man unfurled a Nazi flag at a Bernie Sanders rally in Arizona, indicating that such symbols have been displayed at Sanders' rallies before.
